description: Dive into "Trails of Adventure: Discover Zermatt's Hidden Gems" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Trails of Adventure: Discover Zermatt's Hidden Gems

places.generalDescription: Perched at an altitude of 3,260 meters, Hörnli Hut is a seasonal mountain lodge serving as a base camp for Matterhorn climbers. The popular Hörnli Hut Hike spans approximately 4.5 kilometers and commences at Schwarzsee, guiding hikers through awe-inspiring alpine scenery with steep ascents into high alpine terrain. Adventurous visitors can witness climbers tackling the challenging Matterhorn summit from this vantage point.

sources.snippet: The Hörnli Hut Hike is a popular and exciting trail that leads hikers to one of Switzerland’s most famous mountaineering huts: the Hörnli Hut at the foot of the Matterhorn. This approximately 4.5-kilometer hike starts at Schwarzsee and takes visitors through a breathtaking alpine landscape. The path to the Hörnlihütte is an ascent that leads through steep paths into high alpine terrain.
sources.shortName: Hiking in Zermatt: Best Hikes & Trails

sources.snippet: Award-winning mountain huts with sun-drenched terraces await, exquisite delicacies on the menu. Take in the idyllic hamlets, wonderful Alpine meadows and the most beautiful mountain of them all – the Matterhorn.
sources.shortName: Hiking in the Matterhorn Summer Paradise

sources.snippet: Distance: 8.5 km (5.25 miles) | Difficulty: Strenuous | Total Ascent: 725 meters (2,380 feet) | Time: 4 hours. If you love hiking, the hike to Hörnlihütte is a must-have experience in Zermatt.
sources.shortName: 12 Epic Day Hikes in Zermatt (+ Trail Stats, Photos & Map)

sources.snippet: The 5 Lakes Trail, Gorner Glacier, Hörnlihutte, Schwarzsee, and the list goes on and on. While we didn’t have a ton of time in this beautiful area, we wanted to make the most of it.
The short, steep hike to Hornlihutte offers a unique, up-close opportunity to experience the iconic Matterhorn from the base of the most popular climber’s route to the summit.
sources.shortName: Best Hiking Trails in Zermatt in the Valais, Switzerland

places.name: Hörnlihütte

reviews.text: Absolutely amazing to climb up to and stay in a hut actually on the Matterhorn. Remarkably steep final 350 m ascent, but very well protected.  This site serves a lot of people – mobs of day hikers when I got there early afternoon, and then many climbers and guides in the evening. Given the scale of the operation, the staff remains remarkably cheerful and helpful. And this hut had the best food of any in my two weeks of Alpine hiking! And it was inspiring to hang out with people who just successfully summitted.

So much luxury when you consider where this place is! We hiked up there to have lunch and hiked back. Food was really good and service too considering how much effort it is for the staff to get to work! Some of the best views ever for lunch. If you can handle heights and are fit hiking here for the day it is well worth it. Most people there seem to be gearing up to summit the Matterhorn but some are day trippers like we were.

A wonderful place to stay. Spent one night here on the way up to summit the Matterhorn. It has hot showers (need to pay for a token) and good food. The staff were very nice. They had WiFi which was amazing. We shared a room of 6 but there were only four in our room. When we got back from summiting the Matterhorn we had a lovely welcome and congrats from the owner, his wife, and other staff members. Thank you so much for allowing us to stay at your wonderful accommodation.

places.generalDescription: Riffelsee is a stunning high-altitude lake in Switzerland, offering unparalleled views of the iconic Matterhorn. It's a popular spot for visitors to Zermatt, especially during the spring when the first flowers bloom and in autumn with its beautiful orange-yellow hues. The area offers a challenging hike with loose soil but rewards hikers with breathtaking scenery. To avoid crowds, it's recommended to catch the first or second train up and check the weather beforehand for optimal conditions.

sources.snippet: The trailhead on Rotenboden can be reached either by taking the Gornergrat cable car or by also doing the descent from Gornergrat. From Rotenboden the descent leads through alpine landscapes with lush meadows, colorful alpine flowers and crystal clear mountain streams. Finally, you reach the Riffelsee, one of the most beautiful mountain lakes in the region.
sources.shortName: Hiking in Zermatt: Best Hikes & Trails

sources.snippet: Riffelsee Lake and its sister lake, just a short walk downhill from it. Matterhorn reflections on the lakes. Possibility to spot marmots and blacknose sheep.
sources.shortName: Hiking in Zermatt: 10 BEST Hikes, Map & Useful Tips (Switzerland)

places.name: Riffelsee

reviews.text: Make this your first stop on the way up to Gornergrat!  Beat the wind and see a great reflection on the lake!  Then go up to the top on a subsequent train.  You'll be happy you did!

It's was beautiful and cold and even though we could not make it all the way to the lake and I believe it was snow/frozen over. Words and photos can not describe the scale of how big the mountains are

Absolutely stunning! Woa this is an amazing sight to witness, the mountain reflection on the lake. Donot miss this place! Get down at Rottenboden station and then home down to the lake side. That's the best way to reach here. Photos cannot capture the real pure beauty of the place and the majestic jaw dropping view! If you are lucky you will get a clear day view.

places.generalDescription: Nestled amidst the stunning Swiss Alps, Grunsee is a picturesque lake that enchants visitors with its serene green waters reflecting the majestic mountains above. Accessible via a delightful hiking trail, this hidden gem is part of the renowned 5 Lakes Walk, which meanders through five breathtaking lakes including Grindjisee and Stellisee. The hike to Grunsee is gentle and family-friendly, making it an ideal outing for adventurers of all ages.

sources.snippet: You continue your hike through the Valais mountains to the next stop, Lake Grünsee. Grünsee means green lake in Swiss German and comes from the green water of the lake. Here you will again find an unobstructed view of the mountain panorama, including the Matterhorn.
sources.siteName: Hiking in Zermatt–5 most beautiful hiking trails in summer
sources.shortName: Hiking in Zermatt–5 most beautiful hiking trails in summer

sources.snippet: The 5 lakes walk will take you past the Stelisee, Grindjsee, Grunsee, Moosjisee and Leisee (you will see them in this order if you start from Blauherd). The first two offer spectacular reflections of the Matterhorn in the lake on a clear day.
sources.shortName: Two great moderate trails for hiking in Zermatt, Switzerland

places.name: Grünsee

reviews.text:
Grünsee is definitely one of the better lakes out of the 5 lakes. It is somewhat out of the way but it does not disappoint when you get there!

At Grünsee it is possible to have a swim at this one, making it the perfect half-way point for a dip and picnic etc.

Take your time and enjoy the views! Easy to find if you just follow the 5 lake hike signposts or map.

I've added a couple of extra photos of the hike up or down showing the gorgeous river!
For me this lake was the least beautiful from the 5 lake hike. Water was very clean and I guess would be better in the swimming season.
Good swimming in summer time! In july there was a lot of people like in a beach. It's perfect if you do a medium hiking from Sunnega and then you have a rest here. Good for family time.

places.generalDescription: The Rotenboden - Gornergrat Höhenweg is a challenging long-distance hiking trail that requires high stamina and overnight stays in the mountains. Along the route, there are cozy alpine guesthouses, but some hikers can be particular about accommodations. The trail offers various options from Zermatt to Hohenweg, including the Monte Rosa hut trail or the Gornergrat. The 2.

sources.snippet: The hike from Gornergrat to Riffelsee is an unforgettable experience that will delight hiking lovers in the Zermatt region. Gornergrat, one of the most famous viewpoints in the Swiss Alps, offers spectacular views of the majestic Matterhorn and the surrounding glaciers. From here, the hike to Rotenboden begins.
sources.shortName: Hiking in Zermatt: Best Hikes & Trails

places.name: Rotenboden - Gornergrat Höhenweg

reviews.text: The Gornergrat-Riffelberg 2.5-mile hike is unforgettable. It's all above treeline, over barren soil and rocks, and the beautiful Matterhorn and surrounding glaciers are constantly in view. The Riffelsee is a small, plain alpine lake, but the reflection of the mountain makes the stop worth it. The wilderness experience aspect was offset by the crowds--families carrying infants, toddlers walking alongside their parents, and large tour groups.  But despite that, the experience of hiking this landscape in the shadow of the Matterhorn shouldn't be missed if you're in Zermatt.  And our weather was gorgeous.
Second time here, still as beautiful as! And this time Matterhorn wasn't shy and hiding behind clouds.
Got here with the bahn, hiked down to Riffelberg (one of my fave hikes ever! Really light - going down in around 1hr)

places.generalDescription: Embark on the ultimate Gletschertrekking Monte Rosa Hütte adventure, which includes a thrilling glacier crossing in the stunning Matter Valley. This area is renowned for being home to the highest peaks in the Alps and is surrounded by imposing glaciers. The trek covers a distance of 54.2 km and takes approximately 22 hours to complete, with an elevation gain ranging from 2834m to 3512m.

sources.snippet:
The ultimate hike including glacier crossing in the Matter valley – home to the highest peaks in the Alps and surrounded by imposing glaciers. 54,2 km
  22,0 h
  2834 m
  3512 m

places.name: Gletschertrekking Monte Rosa Hütte

reviews.text:
I enjoyed hiking down along this route from the top of Gornergrat.

Of course you can go reverse from bottom up.
A very nice hike down from Gornergat to Rottenboden. We did this hike to get to the Rifflesee lake. It does take time, do not trust the  time google map says!

(Translated by Google) This is a great hiking route. I recommend going from Rotenboden to Riffelberg. If you are a height expert, you can also go the other way. The most important thing is not to trust Google Maps. It will take much longer than the time indicated on Google. However, the scenery along the way is so beautiful that you will never want to leave. Please pay attention to the train time. In addition, there is no shade along the way, so you need to take enough sun protection...

(Original)
很棒的一條健行路線，建議由上往下走Rotenboden →Riffelberg ，如果你是當身高手，當然也可以反向，最主要別相信Google地圖，所需時間應該用比Google標示時間多很多，但是沿途風光美不勝收，讓你流連忘返，要注意火車時間，另外，沿途沒有遮蔭的地方，防曬要做足⋯⋯

places.generalDescription: Oberrothorn, the highest hiking trail in Zermatt and the second highest in Switzerland, offers a challenging yet rewarding experience for hikers. With a total ascent of 445 meters over 5.8 km, reaching the summit at 3415m provides breathtaking 360-degree views of 38 peaks over 13,000-ft and surrounding glaciers. The trail is known for its low gradient, making it manageable for hikers to maintain their pace.

sources.snippet: Distance: 5.8 km (3.6 miles) | Difficulty: Strenuous | Total Ascent: 445 meters (1,500 feet) | Time: 3 to 4 hours. The trail to Oberrothorn is the highest hiking trail in Zermatt. Once at the top of the mountain peak, you will have a view of 38 mountains that stand higher than 4,000 meters.
sources.shortName: 12 Epic Day Hikes in Zermatt (+ Trail Stats, Photos & Map)

sources.snippet: The second highest hiking trail in Switzerland leads to the summit of the Oberrothorn (11,200-ft.) with splendid, 360-degree views of 38 peaks over 13,000-ft.
sources.shortName: Best Hiking Trails in Zermatt in the Valais, Switzerland

places.name: Oberrothorn

reviews.text: If you want the best experience I would recommend to start your hike in Täsch, however in order to make it to the the Oberrothhorn via this route you must be in excellent condition. The scenery along the path is beautiful, lots of wildlife and small animals. The views on the nearby mountains are spectacular especially the  Matterhorn looks stunning in the morning light. There are two ways to the Oberrothhorn. Personally I took the way over the ridge to the Unterrothhorn and from there You hike a bit down and start hiking to the Oberrothhorn. There is also a path around the Unterrothhorn wich is easier but a kilometer longer approximately. The hike on the Oberrothhorn is easy and doesn't get hard in anyway, there is one point with a rope but you don't really need it. The views on the top are spectacular. You are able to see all the mountains surrounding you in a spectacular fashion. On the way down I choose to go to Zermatt and take the train from there to Täsch. The hike was 35km long and the elevation gain was 2000m. It took me a full day of walking. I would recommend to get an early start to beat the heat lower on the mountain.

They claim it's the highest peak in Europe you can climb by a regular hiking trail. Located on the 3415m altitude it offers breathtaking 360 panorama on the surrounding snow capped peaks and glaciers.

You can climb here from Rothorn (around 400m elevation gain) or Blauherd (slightly under 900m). The climb is easy, it has low gradient all the time, so you can easily keep your pace.

Don't try it on your first day in Zermatt though, you need some acclimatization before climbing to that altitude.
The climb was worth it! Beautiful scenery.
